description: The Philippines Bacolod City also ordered the implementation of a curfew here from 10 p.m. to 4 a.m. (announced and effective on Mar. 17)

The Philippines Bacolod City Mayor Evelio Leonardia, in a late afternoon news conference at the Government Center here, announced that he had signed Executive Order No. 26 that places the city under an Enhanced Community Quarantine from 30 March to 14 April 2020. A 24-hour curfew will be observed by the general public, except for identified holders of Home Quarantine Pass who will be allowed to leave for provisions from 4 am to 10 pm. UPDATE: General Community Quarantine (curfew) was announced on March 17. On Mar. 27, Barcolod City announced Enhanced Community Quarantine
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Starting March 17, 2021 The Metro Manila Council through the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority prohibited minors aged 15-17 from going outdoors for two weeks in all the 17 LGUs comprising the National Capital Region.

description: The Office of the President of the Philippines require that all heads of departments, agencies, offices and instrumentalities of the government, controlled corporations (GOCCs), government financial institutions (GFIs), state universities and colleges (SUCs) and local government units (LGUs), implement travel restrictions by banning passengers, excluding Filipino citizens and holders of Permanent Resident Visa, from any regions of China into the Philippines on Feb. 1, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Philippine Foreign Service Posts are temporarily suspending the issuance of visas, effective immediately, to the following:

1) Foreign nationals directly coming from China and its Special Administrative Regions; and
2) Foreign nationals, who, within fourteen (14) days immediately preceding arrival in the Philippines, have been to China, and its Special Administrative Regions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
The Philippine Department of Foreign Affairs: (announced and effective on March 3)

- Temporary ban of entry into the Philippines of any person coming from the North Gyeongsang Province (including Daegu City and Cheongdo County) of South Korea.

- Temporary ban of entry into the Philippines of any person who has been to the North Gyeongsang Province (including Daegu City and Cheongdo County) of South Korea within 14 days immediately preceding their arrival in the Philippines.

Filipino citizens, including their foreign spouses and children, holders of Permanent Resident Visas, and holders of Diplomatic Visas issued by the Philippine Government are exempted from this temporary travel ban but must follow the health protocols of the Department of Health.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_province: North Gyeongsang Province (including Daegu City and Cheongdo County)

description:
Foreign nationals are temporarily barred anew from entering the country after the Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) suspended its issuance of visas in all foreign service posts all over the world. (announced on Mar. 20 and effective on Mar. 22)

Only OFWs (overseas Filipino workers), repatriating Filipinos, their foreign spouses and children (provided that the foreign spouse and children are traveling with the Filipino national), foreign government and international organization officials accredited to the Philippines, will be allowed to enter the country.

description:
March 22, 2021 to April 21, 2021 the Philippine government has suspended the entry of all foreign nationals. The number of inbound international passengers has been limited to 1,500 per day.

The following are exempt from entry ban: Diplomats and members of international organizations, and their dependents who hold valid 9(e) visa or 47(a)(2) visa,  foreign nationals involved in medical repatriation duly endorsed by Department of Foreign Affairs – Office of the Undersecretary for Migrant Workers Affairs and Overseas Workers Welfare Administration who hold a valid visa, foreign seafarers under the “Green Lanes” program for crew change, provided that they hold a 9(c) crew list visa, foreign spouses and children of Filipino citizens travelling with the Filipino citizen who hold a valid visa, emergency, humanitarian, and other analogous cases approved by the Chairperson of the NTF COVID-19 or his duly authorized representative, provided the foreign nationals have valid visas at the time of entry.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
The Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte has signed a law on March 25 that grants him special powers to step up the government’s fight against the coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid-19).

In a text message sent to reporters early Wednesday morning, Senator Christopher Lawrence Go confirmed that Duterte inked Republic Act (RA) 11469 or the "Bayanihan to Heal as One Act".
type_text: The Congress grants the President of the Philippines special powers to tackle COVID-19.

description: The Philippines Department of Health provided a new classification of the patients infected by the disease in the country based on the international system, replacing the terms "persons under monitoring" and "patients under investigation" with terms "suspect," "probable" and "confirmed" instead on April 12, 2020.
type_text: The policy introduced a new classification of Covid-19 cases to provide a more uniformed reporting and a more focused approach in preventing the spread of the virus
